cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, or 90 miles E of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the northern Caribbean, forecast to pass near the Turks & Caicos and southeast Bahamas Thursday–Friday, then approach the Florida Straits Saturday and turn northward up the Florida peninsula toward Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Cuba from Matanzas eastward and the central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through the Bahamas, Cuba, then the entire Florida peninsula and adjacent Georgia coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are 42% likely; 19% chance of 50-kt winds; 9% chance of hurricane-force winds as Irma tracks northward toward the port late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large, long-period swells and onshore flow ahead of Irma could drive 3–5 ft of storm surge along the northeast Florida coast and up the St. Johns River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could deliver 4–8 inches, locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood threats in the Jacksonville metro and river basins.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands.
